intro: Meriania furvanthera, commonly known as the golden star hibiscus, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-centered flowers with white petals, which bloom during the dry season. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, while the bark is smooth and grayish in color.
